name: sfchronicle
text:
BART shaved off $12 millon from its budget deficit and hopes to save millions more with a staff retirement incentive program approved Thursday. The agency says the savings will help it avoid layoffs for now.

https://t.co/2PBnuAUSfg

name: sfchronicle
text:
San Mateo supervisor David Canepa voiced opposition to Gov. Newsom’s curfew.

“As far as I know the disease is just as deadly between 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. as it is from 10 p.m. to 5 a.m.,” Canepa’s statement said.

https://t.co/jL6qzyL9Pm

name: sfchronicle
text: How one winemaker is coping with losing 2020 vintage to wildfires? It involves pears. https://t.co/0M0jXrdCGF

name: sfchronicle
text:
St. Mary’s alums Jordan Ford and Malik Fitts will remain teammates at least for a while in the pros. Each has signed a free-agent contract with the Los Angeles Clippers.

https://t.co/I3P9IYBfks
